Replies.Reply: Darkness. That's the first thing I remember. It was dark, and it was cold. And I was scared.
But then...then I saw the moon. It was so big and it was so bright, and it seemed to chase the darkness away. And when it did...I wasn't scared anymore.
Why I was there, and what I was meant to do - that I've never known. And a part of me wonders if I ever will.
Oh, ah, excuse me, can you tell me where I am?
My name is Jack Frost -- how do I know that? The moon told me so.
Ah, now that, that was fun.
Huh, that looks interesting. Good book?
Oh he's real alright. Real annoying, real grumpy, and really full of himself.
Whoa, don't worry kid, I gotcha.
Hold on. It's gonna be alright.
Keep up with me kid! Take a left.
Ah, wait a minute! Come on, hold on, hold on! What about all that fun we just had? That wasn't the Tooth Fairy, that was me!
What's a guy gotta do to get a little attention around here!
If there's something I'm doing wrong, can you, can you just tell me what it is?
Because I've tried everything, and no one ever sees me.
You put me here, the least you can do is tell me, tell me why.
Bunny? You're not still mad about that...are yah?
Wow, you gotta be kidding me.
Hey, hey. Whoa, put me down.
Oh, yeah. I love being shoved in a sack and tossed through a magic portal.
Hey! Ho! Anyone wanna tell me why I'm here?
That's not really helping. But thanks, little man.
I musta done something really bad to get you four together.
Am I on the naughty list?
What are you doing! Get, get that offa me!
What makes you think I want to be a Guardian?
Look, this is all very flattering, but ah...you don't want me. You're all hard work and deadlines, and I'm snowballs and fun times. I'm not a Guardian.
All the more reason to pick someone more qualified!
The Man in the Moon, he talks to you?
But why, why wouldn't he tell me that himself?
After 300 years this is his answer?
Uhh, you ever hear of a snow day?
Oh. And this whole time I thought you were. If you're not a kangaroo, what are you?
It's nothing personal, North. What you all do, it's just, it's not my thing.
Slow down, wouldja? I've been trying to bust in here for years, I want a good look.
Oh, don't worry, I never got past the yetis.
I always thought the elves made the toys.
North, North! I told you, I'm not going with you guys! There is no way I'm climbing into some rickety old...
Okay, one ride, but that's it.
Hey little Baby Tooth, you okay?
Why would Pitch take the teeth?
But, I wasn't anyone before I was Jack Frost.
That night at the pond...I just, why I assumed...Are you saying, are you saying I had a life before that? With a home? And a family?
All these years, and the answers were right here. If I find my memories, then I'll know why I'm here.
Then we have to get them back!
Hop to it rabbit, I'm five teeth ahead!
How long is a long time?
It's a little different up close, huh?
Yeah, well, look let's just get you taken care of. Then it's Pitch's turn, huh?
You think I need help to beat a bunny? Check it out, Peter Cottontail.
But that's a um, that's a greyhound. Do you know what greyhounds do to rabbits?
Oh, I really wish I had a camera right now.
Sandy, c'mon! We can find Pitch.
Sandy! Sandy, did you see that?!?
You made it my fight when you stole those teeth.
Remind me not to get on your bad side.
You take the ones on the left, I'll take the ones on the right?
Jack presses on, trying to reach Sandy as fast as he can.
Horrified, clenches his staff as he flies toward Pitch.
Jack quickly realizes that's he's in over his head as the attacking Nightmares begin to overtake him. He's engulfed by Nightmares and there is nothing but silence.
I, I didn't know I could.
I just, I wish I could've done something.
But how can I know who I am, until I find out who I was?
It's fear. He's tipped the balance.
Don't look at me, I'm invisible, remember?
Blood and gums? When was the last time you guys actually hung out with kids?
If one little kid can ruin Easter, then...we're in worse shape than I thought.
Uh, how much time do we have?
Look, I'm sorry about that whole, you know, the "kangaroo" thing.
How about I take her home?
Trust me, I'll be quick as a bunny.
That voice, I know that voice...
I have to find out what that is.
I'm gonna get you out of here, just as soon as I --
You don't know what I am!
No, listen, listen...I'm sorry. I didn't mean for this to happen.
No, they'll fear both of us. And that's not what I want.
Now for the last time, leave me alone.
Sorry, all I can do is keep you cold.
Pitch was right - I make a mess of everything.
It's okay. It's okay. Don't look down, just look at me.
I know, I know...but you're gonna be alright. You're not gonna fall in. We're gonna have a little fun instead.
Well, alright. Well, not, not this time. I promise. I promise, you're gonna be...you're gonna be fine.
You have to believe in me.
You wanna play a game? We're going to play Hopscotch! Like we play every day!
Did you -- did you see that?
It -- it was me! I had a family!
We have to get out of here.
Come on Baby Tooth! I owe you one.
He said it again. He said --
Can you... Can you see me?
He sees me. He sees me!
Yeah! Who do you think brings you all the blizzards and snow days, and you remember when you went flying on that sled the other day?!
Real-real-real! Every one of us is real!
He's stronger. I can't beat him.
I know, I know. But you're gonna be alright...
We're gonnna have a little fun, instead.
Now let's go get your friends.
It's over Pitch! There's no place to hide.
It took awhile, but I figured it out.
Looks like it's your fear they smell.
Hey, hey, slow down, slow down.
Okay, well do you stop believing in the sun when clouds block it out?
We'll always be there, Jamie. And now...we'll always be here.
Which kind of makes you a Guardian too.
My name is Jack Frost. And I'm a Guardian. How do I know that?
How many times have I told you to knock?
Shoo with your pointy heads. Why are you always under boot?
Have you checked the axis? Is rotation balanced?
Make preparations! We are going to have company.
My fellow Guardians - It is our job to watch over the children of the world, and keep them safe - to bring wonder, hope and dreams.
An enemy we have kept at bay for centuries has finally decided to strike back. We alone can stop him.
I know, I know, but I obviously wouldn't have called you all here unless it was serious.
The Boogie Man was here - at the Pole.
Yes! There was black sand covering the globe.
Look, he is up to something very bad. I feel it, in my belly.
Please. Bunny. Easter is not Christmas.
No matter how much you paint, is still egg!
Why are rabbits always so nervous.
Tooth! Can't you see we're trying to argue.
I know it was him. We have serious situation!
Aah! Man in Moon! Sandy, why didn't you say something?
It's been a long time old friend!
Must be big deal! Manny thinks we need help!
Hey, there he is! Jack Frost!
I hope the yetis treated you well?
Oh, good! That was my idea! You know Bunny, obviously.
On naughty list? You hold record!
How come? I tell you how come!
A child who believes. And good or bad, naughty or nice, we protect them.
Okay, no more wishy-washy! Pitch is out there doing who knows what!
Yes! When Pitch threatens us, he threatens them as well.
Pick? You think we pick? No, you were chosen like we were all chosen. By Man in Moon.
You see, you can not say no. It is destiny.
Man in Moon says it is your thing.
We just let them believe that.
Very nice! Keep up good work!
I don't like it. Paint it red.
Now we get down to tacks of brass!
Who are you, Jack Frost? What is your center?
If Man in Moon chose you to be a Guardian, you must have something very special inside.
Here. This is how you see me, no?
Look closer. What do you see?
Yes! Big eyes. Very big. Because they are full! Of wonder! That is my center. It is what I was born with. Eyes that have always seen the wonder in everything!
Eyes that see lights in the trees, and magic in the air!
This wonder is what I put into the world, and what I protect in children.
It is what makes me a Guardian. It is my center. What is yours?
Boys, ship shape. As soon as impossible.
Hey! Moi deti, moi deti. Quiet, quiet.
Bunny, what are you waiting for?
I hope you like the loopty loops!
Hold on everyone, I know a shortcut.
This is one time I wish I was wrong. But he will pay.
No! No! No such thing as too late!
Wait, wait, wait, wait, wait, wait, wait. Idea!! HAHH!!
We get teeth! Children keep believing in you!
Give me break! You know how many toys I deliver in one night?
And Jack, if you help us, we will get you your memories.
A race? Is it a race??
Haha! That's what I want to hear.
Gentlemen! Gentlemen! This is about Tooth. It's not a competition! But if it was --
Done something? Jack, you stood up to Pitch. You saved us.
Would be proud of what you did.
I don't know who you were in your past life, but in this life you are Guardian.
You will. I feel it, in my belly.
As much as it pains me to say old friend, this time Easter is more important than Christmas!
We must hurry to the Warren.
We are very busy bringing joy to children! We don't have time...
Rimsky Korsakov! That's a lot of eggs.
The Nightmares attacked the tunnels. They smashed every egg, crushed every basket. Nothing made it to the surface.
That is why you weren't here?
Is official. My powers are kaput.
Losing Easter took its toll on all of us. Bunny most of all.
That was good try, Jack! A for effort!
So what? As long as one child believes, we will be here to fight fear!
They can't be my Nightmares, I'm not afraid.
Then is time you take Oath.
"Will you, Jack Frost...vow to watch over the children of the world?
To guard them with your life -
The Globe pulses with ENERGY, which lights up and ZOOMS UP the AXIS SHAFT toward the roof--
Chicago, Sector 6 -- 37 molars, 22 bicuspids, 18 central incisors.
It's her first tooth. Have you ever seen a more adorable lateral incisor in all of your life?!
Montreal, sector six: ten premolars, eight incisors and twelve canines. Steer clear of the wild goose migration.
Argentina. Priority alert! A batch of bicuspids in Buenos Aires.
Ontario, sector nine: five canines, two molars, and fourteen incisors.
Sorry, not all of us get to work one night a year. Am I right, Sandy?
San Diego, sector two! Five incisors, a bicuspid and a really loose molar on stand-by.
Hey, I hate to interrupt the, "We work so hard once a year club" but could we concentrate on the matter--
Ah, guys, you know what this means?
I wonder who it's gonna be?
Well, ah, as long he helps to ah...to protect the children, right?
Tangiers! Incivie du haut, 421 rue de Barat! Allez!
Walla Walla, Washington. We've got a trampoline mishap at 1340 Ginger Lane.
Hello, Jack. I've heard a lot about you. And your teeth.
Open up! Are they really as white as they say? Yes!
Oh, they really do sparkle like freshly fallen snow.
Jack...I don't think you understand what it is we do.
Each of those lights is a child.
Last night, Jack. He chose you.
They, they took my fairies! And the teeth! All of them!
Oh thank goodness! One of you is alright!
Pitch, you have got thirty seconds to return my fairies!
They, they don't believe in me anymore.
You should've seen them. They put up such a fight.
It's not the teeth he wanted. It's the memories inside them.
That's why we collect the teeth, Jack. They hold the most important memories of childhood.
My fairies and I watch over them and when someone needs to remember what's important, we help them.
We had everyone's here. Yours too.
From when you were young. Before you became Jack Frost.
Of course you were. We were all someone before we were chosen.
I...I can't, Jack. Pitch has them.
Four bicuspids over there! An incisor two blocks east! Is that a molar? They're EVERYWHERE!
Fine...sorry, it's been a really long time since I've been out in the field.
Ah, four hundred forty years...give or take.
Whoa, whoa, whoa! Take it easy there, champ! He's one of us!
Wow! You guys collect teeth and leave gifts as fast as my fairies.
You guys have been leaving gifts, right?
Left central incisor, knocked out in a freak sledding accident. I wonder how that could have happened, Jack?
This was always the part I liked most - seeing the kids.
Why did I ever stop doing this?
Thanks for being here, Jack. I wish I had known about your memory, I could've helped you.
Shhh! You guys, he's still awake.
Hey, this is not proper Tooth Fairy behavior!
Jack, how did you do that?
Look how fast they're going out.
Don't worry, Bunny. I bet she's a fairy fan.
Awww! You know what, I got something for you. Here it is.
Look at all the pretty teeth with little blood and gum on them.
I think it's time to get her home.
Oh Jack, what have you done?
I can't feel my feet! I can't feel my feet!
Oh, this better be good, North.
What, what...what do you mean black sand?
Hold on, hold on, I thought you said you saw Pitch.
Not exactly? Can you believe this guy?
Hang on, hang on, you mean to say, you summoned me here THREE DAYS BEFORE EASTER - because of your belly? Mate, if I did this to you three days before Christmas--
North, I, I don't have time for this. I've still got two million eggs to finish up.
Look, mate, I'm dealing with perishables. Right. You've got all year to prepare.
And why are you always such a blowhard!
Come on, mate, Pitch went out with the dark ages. We made sure of that - remember?
Well, I've got a serious situation with some eggs.
Since when do we need help?!
Please not the groundhog, please not the groundhog.
Ah, I take it back! The Groundhog's fine!
Jack Frost!? He doesn't care about children! All he does is freeze water pipes and mess with my egg hunts. Right? He's an irresponsible, selfish...
Jack Frost is many things, but he is not a Guardian.
Been a long time. Blizzard of 68, I believe? Easter Sunday, wasn't it?
But this is about something else.
Not on your nelly. See you back at the pole.
Yeah, that's exactly what I said!
You know what I think? I think we just dodged a bullet. I mean, what's this clown know about bringing joy to children anyway?
But none of 'em believe in you.
Do they? You see, you're invisible, mate. It's like you don't even exist.
The, the what -- what'd you call me? I am not a kangaroo, mate.
I'm a bunny. The Easter Bunny.
We have a problem, mate! Trouble at the Tooth Palace.
I think my tunnels might be faster, mate. And um, and safer.
Whoa, whoa, whoa, where are the bloody seatbelts?!
Ah, rack off you bloody show pony!
Oh strewth, I knew we should have taken the tunnels.
What fear? Of you!? No one's been afraid of you since the Dark Ages!
Okay, alright I admit it, you were right about Pitch.
Hey, I told you never to mention that!
And eggs I hide in one day?
Here we go, here we go...
Yeah right, look, I'd tell you to stay outta my way, but really what's the point -- because you won't be able to keep up anyway.
Oh, you don't wanna race a rabbit, mate.
Looks like you're a bit of a brumby, hey mate.
Oh I see how it is...
All working together to make sure the rabbit gets last place.
You call that a bag of choppers?
Now that's a bag of choppers.
I think it's a pretty safe bet he's never met a rabbit like me -
Ah, this thing's rabid! Get this dingo off me!
Hey, buck up ya sad-sacks. Come on! We can still turn this around!
Easter is tomorrow and I need your help. I say we pull out all the stops and we get those little lights flickering again!
You wanna paint some eggs? Yeah?
Alright troops, it's time to push back. That means eggs!
Heaps of you in every high-rise, farm house and trailer park!
In tennis shoes and cereal bowls!
Oh, there will be bathtubs filled with my beautiful googies!
There will be springtime! On every continent! And I'm bringing hope with me!
Now all we gotta do is get him and his little mates through the tunnels, to the top, and we'll have ourselves Easter.
Ah, poor little ankle-biter. Look at her, all tuckered out.
Which is why we need you here, with us.
Yes there is! There is! I mean these aren't my best lookin' googies, but they'll do in a pinch!
No! Wrong! Not, not true! I'm right in front of ya, mate!
We should never have trusted you!
Easter is new beginnings, new life.
Now somebody sees me! I mean, where were you about an hour ago, mate?
Did you tell him to say that?
That's it! Let's go! Me and you!
He made you believe? In me?
Dead end. Other way other way!
If you want him, you're gonna have to go through me!
Don't you even think about it!
Oh yeah, come on, come on!
Mate, you are a sight for sore eyes!
Yeah! Wooo! Good job, mate. Good job!
Hey guys, wait up! Are you guys coming to the egg hunt Sunday?
Whoa, it says here that they found Big Foot hair samples and DNA, in Michigan. That's like, super close!
You saw the video too Claude, he's out there!
Wow, the Easter Bunny is real!
A sofa from the moving van suddenly knocks Jamie down...
I gotta put this under my pillow!

...I did this jump and it was amazing and I slide under a car and it was awesome! Then I was flying down this hill and I was like whoosh, whoosh, whoosh through all these cars, and then the sled hit this, this thing, and I was like way up in the air.
-- and then BAM! The sofa hit me, and, and see?
But I can do it this time! You wanna help me, Soph? We can hide and see the Tooth Fairy!
The Easter Bunny?...Sandman...The Tooth Fairy! I knew you'd come!
No, stop that's the Easter Bunny.
Guys, I told you - I saw him! He's way bigger than I thought, and he's got these cool boomerang-things-
Okay look, you and I are obviously at what they call a crossroads, so here's what's gonna happen -
If it wasn't a dream and if you are real, then you have to prove it.
I've believed in you for a long time, okay? Like my whole life in fact. So you kinda owe me now.
You don't have to do much, just a little sign so I know. Anything.
But what about the Easter Bunny and the Tooth Fairy I mean--
Wow! It is you! I mean it is you!
What happened to him? He used to be huge and cool! And now he's cute.
No! Actually he told me you were real. Just when I started to think that maybe you weren't.
Jack Frost! Come on, we need your help!
I do believe in you. I'm just not afraid of you.
I know what we have to do! Guys, come on!
You're leaving? But, what if Pitch comes back?
What if we stop believing again?
That's what you said about aliens.
It was a dream. You should be happy you still get dreams like that and not...
I hope we can find the eggs with all this snow!
Come on, you guys believe anything.
Forget it, Jamie. There's just no Easter this year.
Jamie, how are you doing that?!
"Oh, I'm cold, I'm cold, I'm co-
Come on guys, we can do it!
Jamie! Turn, turn! That's the street! What are you doing? Stop!
Dude, that means cash! Tooth Fairy cash! I love the Tooth Fairy!
That's totally awesome. You lucky bug! Lucky!
I wish I lost my tooth.
I lost two teeth in one day once -
Let's go...I'm cooold! My ears are freezing. I can't feel my toes.
Somebody take a picture. Hey, stop! That was really awesome.
Man, this is so cool! Yeah, alright! Wahoo! Wow!
Oh man! Woo! Yeah, Jack! Yeah, Jack! Yeah! Wooo!
Jack! You did it Jack! Wooo!
Wow, it's real. That is wicked!
Wow! Look at that! So totally insane!
Whoa! It's beautiful. Wow, that was awesome!
I can't keep my eyes open. I think I gotta go home. Let's go home.
Ohhhh, I thought I heard the clippity-clop of a unicorn. What an adorable dream!
And look. At. Her. Precious child. So sweet, so full of hope and wonder. Why, there's only one thing missing...a touch of fear.
Feel your fear. Come on. Come on, that's right.
Yesss. What a pretty little Nightmare.
Now, I want you to go tell the others the wait is over.
Don't look at me like that, old friend. You must have known this day would come. My Nightmares are finally ready. Are your Guardians?
I have to say, this is very, very exciting.
The Big Four, all in one place.
You'll stick a quarter under my pillow?
Maybe I want what you have. To be believed in.
Maybe I'm tired of hiding under beds.
Ah, go suck an egg, rabbit!
Since when are you all so chummy?
A neutral party. Then I'm going to ignore you. But, you must be used to that by now.
Look familiar, Sandman? Took me a while to perfect this little trick.
Don't be nervous, it only riles them up more. They smell fear you know.
But then the Man in the Moon chose you to replace my fear with your wonder and light!
Lifting their hearts! And giving them hope!
Meanwhile, everyone wrote me off as just a bad dream! "Oh, there's nothing to be afraid of! There's no such thing as the Boogeyman!"
Well that's all about to change.
Children are waking up and realizing the Tooth Fairy never came.
I mean such a little thing, but to a child...

Didn't they tell you, Jack? It's great being a Guardian -- but there's a catch. If enough kids stop believing, everything your friends protect - wonder, hopes and dreams - it all goes away. And little by little, so do they.
No Christmas, or Easter, or little fairies that come in the night.
The lights...why aren't they going out?
Oh pipe down, or I'll stuff a pillow with you!
Fine, have your last hurrah. For tomorrow, all you pathetic scrambling will be for nothing.
You know, for a "neutral party" you spend an awful lot of time with those weirdos.
Teeth? Why do you care about the teeth?
Now this is who I'm looking for--
Okay, easy! You can't blame me for trying, Sandy. You don't know what it's like to be weak and hated. It was stupid of me to mess with your dreams. So I'll tell you what-
Before Jack and Sandy can react, a Nightmare shoots up through a storm drain as several other Nightmares gather in the alley behind him.
Pitch gives a signal and leaps into the air, leading another wave of Nightmares after the Guardians.
Pitch rises from behind a group of Nightmares. He stretches his arms as an ARROW of NIGHTMARE SAND forms behind him.
Pitch takes aim and releases the arrow. It flies through the air and into SANDY'S back, exploding on impact.
Sandy feels the shock and turns around. A patch of blackness starts slowly spreading across his body. Pitch laughs as he and Sandy lock eyes.
Hahahahaha!...Don't fight the fear, little man.
Pitch relishes this moment of triumph.
I'd say sweet dreams, but there aren't any left.
Is beyond delighted. His plan actually worked!
Pitch looks on with a smile until a bolt of lightning suddenly erupts from within the writhing black sand.
Finally! Someone who knows how to have a little FUN!
Don't be afraid, Jack. I'm not going to hurt you.
Maybe not. But you are afraid of something.
I know so. It's the one thing I always know.
People's greatest fears. Yours is that no one will ever believe in you.
And worst of all, you're afraid you'll never know why. Why you?
Well fear not, for the answer to that...
Do you want them, Jack? Your memories?
Why did you end up like this?
Well let me ease your mind about one thing. They'll never accept you. Not really.
After all, you're not one of them.
Of course I do. You're Jack Frost.
More to the point Jack, what did you do?
They never really believed in you.
No? I don't know what it's like to be cast out?
All those years in the shadows I thought, no one else knows what this feels like. But now I see I was wrong.
We don't have to be alone, Jack.
I believe in you. And I know children will too.
Yes! Look at what we can do!
What goes together better than cold and dark?
We can make them believe. We'll give them a world where everything, everything is...
And Jack Frost too. They'll believe in both of us.
Very well. You want to be left alone? Done. But first...
You have a bad habit of interfering. Now hand it over.
No. You said you wanted to be alone.
You're all free to go! We won't be needing any Christmas toys this year, thank you! Nor ever again!
Only six left! Six precious children who still believe in the Guardians with all their h--
Jack Frost! Let's end this, shall we?
That little trick doesn't work on me anymore.
All this fuss over one little boy.
Very well. There are other ways to snuff out a light.
Look how fluffy you are! Would you like a scratch behind the ears?
I can't tell you how happy it makes me to see you all like this. You look awful.
So what do you think, Jamie? Do you believe in the Boogiema...
You think a few children can help you? Against this!
Still think there's no such thing as the boogeyman?
You dare have fun in my presence!
You can't get rid of me! Not forever! There will always be fear!
Really? Then what are they doing here?
Did you leave the windows open again? The garage door is wide open.
THOOMP -- she smacks into a TOOTHPASTE BILLBOARD.
Jack can't resist: he reaches over stealthily and SETS OFF THE ALARM CLOCK with his staff. RRRRRIIIIING!
Back in the sleigh, Bunny jumps out and lands on a nearby roof.
Jack and the Guardians watch as more Nightmares speed away to join their herd. Sandy looks overwhelmed by the onslaught.
Sandy high up in he clouds, does his best to contain the MASS OF NIGHTMARES that are swirling around him.
Sandy stands up, accepting his fate, and closes his eyes as he and his Dreamsand cloud are consumed by the writhing blackness of the Nightmare sand.
Sandy's gone. His beautiful Golden Dreamsand, now black, merges with the rest of Pitch's Nightmare sand.
Ohh no, mate. My warren my rules.
As Sophie leads a parade of eggs, Bunny jumps to an adjacent rock and sits up to address the eggs as they walk in stride.
Colored eggs wade through the water, emerging with SECONDARY COLORS and intricate PATTERNS of all kinds.
There are no eggs. There's none anywhere. I give up. Come on, let's go. I don't understand.
There's no such thing. I know.
Maybe he just hid them really well this year.
There's no such thing as the Easter Bunny.
Baby Tooth struggles to get loose, but Pitch only tightens his grip. She can hardly breathe. Jack has no choice.

START JACK'S MEMORY  We are on an eye, a familiar eye but this one is brown not blue. PULL BACK to reveal young JACK, brown hair, brown eyes. He is staring directly at the camera, a look of...what is it? It's hard to read but it's VERY intense. We keep pulling back to reveal him dressed as we first saw him in 16th century clothes. Behind him, dark winter trees and snow come in to focus.

We're looking up at the hole in the ice, descending into the dark icy depths...then THE FULL MOON appears from behind the clouds as Jack's hands claw through the water towards it, but it's helpless. The MOON glows bright...brighter...
